name: inviolably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that must be respected and cannot be removed or ignored: Poetry is always inviolably itself. I assured her that you would keep inviolably the secret between them.
More examplesFewer examplesThe problem is any system of thought that insists that one group of people are inviolably in the right, whereas the others are in the wrong.The editors insisted that English, unlike French, is inviolably flexible.The articles of this confederation shall be inviolably observed by every state.
